message:
Bottom line is, if you are trying to change someoneâ€™s mind, criticism is not an effective way to do it.
--
Don't call someone's baby ugly !
story: Abdelrady Fcis shared his post to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Abdelrady

data.message:
I generally agree with the message in this post - the one that says you don't have to be a jerk to disagree with someone - but I also think a lot of people in the tech community take a lot of things way too personally. 
While being mean or overly frustrated at a product/tool is not the most civilized way to go about debating its faults, it's not meant (or it shouldn't be meant) as an insult to the developer/people behind it. 
It's not comparable to calling someone's baby ugly, even if they did put their "heart and soul" into it, because unlike an actual baby, the look/feel/performance of a tool you use is directly relevant to you, and it can actually be improved.
